solution_line_template: If the sum of their ages is {sum_ages}, and Asaf is {asaf_age} years old, Alexander is {sum_ages}-{asaf_age} = <<{sum_ages}-{asaf_age}={alexander_age}>>{alexander_age} years old.
The age difference between Asaf and Alexander's age is {alexander_age}-{asaf_age} = <<{alexander_age}-{asaf_age}={age_difference}>>{age_difference}

Since the age difference between Asaf and Alexander's age is half the total number of pencils Asaf has, Asaf has {multiplier_for_half}*{age_difference} = <<{multiplier_for_half}*{age_difference}={asaf_pencils}>>{asaf_pencils} pencils.

If Alexander has {alexander_more_pencils} more pencils than Asaf, Alexander has {asaf_pencils}+{alexander_more_pencils}= <<{alexander_more_pencils}+{asaf_pencils}={alexander_pencils}>>{alexander_pencils} pencils.
